question: The Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) is headquartered in which city?
explanation:
The Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) is headquartered at Riyadh, Saudi Arabia.
India held Troika-level talks with the Gulf Cooperation Council, in a virtual mode. The Indian delegation was led by External Affairs Minister Dr. S. Jaishankar. Senior representatives from UAE, Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, Bahrain and Qatar also participated in the meeting.
